data.title: OpenAPC · Transparent Infrastructure for Article Charges
data.text:
IFW reports its 2020 APC expenditures

The Leibniz Institute for Solid State and Materials Research Dresden (IFW) has updated its APC expenditures, providing data for the 2020 period.

Contact Person for the contributed IFW data is Jana Sonnenstuhl.

Cost data

The new data set covers publication fees for 30 articles, total expenditure amounts to 68,813â¬ and the average fee is 2,294â¬.

The following table provides an overview of the new data:

Â Articles Fees paid in EURO Mean Fee paid Elsevier BV 5 12350 2470 MDPI AG 5 7560 1512 Wiley-Blackwell 5 17362 3472 American Physical Society (APS) 4 8244 2061 Springer Nature 3 7674 2558 AIP Publishing 2 4285 2142 American Chemical Society (ACS) 2 6183 3092 Frontiers Media SA 1 1750 1750 Institute of Electrical & Electronics Engineers (IEEE) 1 1478 1478 Royal Society of Chemistry (RSC) 1 845 845 The Royal Society 1 1080 1080

Overview

With the recent contribution included, the overall APC data for the IFW now looks as follows:

University of Kassel reports its 2021 APC expenditures

The University of Kassel has updated its APC expenditures, providing data for the 2021 period.

Kassel University Library is in charge of the institutionâs Open Access Publication Funds, which received support by the Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft (DFG) under its Open-Access Publishing Programme until 2019.

In addition, Kassel University Library has also reported data on articles published under the DEAL agreements with Wiley and Springer in 2020.

Contact person is Dr. Tobias Pohlmann.

Cost data

The new data set covers publication fees for 96 articles, total expenditure amounts to 155 093â¬ and the average fee is 1 616â¬.

The following table shows the payments Kassel University Library has made to publishers since its last contribution. Please note that articles published in hybrid journals under the DEAL agreements are not included in this list, as they are aggregated in OpenAPCâs transformative agreements data set.

IFW joins OpenAPC

We welcome the Leibniz Institute for Solid State and Materials Research Dresden (IFW) as new contributing institution!

Contact Person for the contributed IFW data is Jana Sonnenstuhl.

Cost data

The initial data set provided by the IFW covers publication fees for 28 articles published in 2021, total expenditure amounts to 69,459â¬ and the average fee is 2,481â¬.

Â Articles Fees paid in EURO Mean Fee paid Elsevier BV 10 28880 2888 Springer Nature 6 16143 2691 Wiley-Blackwell 3 8002 2667 American Chemical Society (ACS) 2 3046 1523 American Physical Society (APS) 2 4315 2158 MDPI AG 2 1642 821 AAAS 1 3361 3361 AIP Publishing 1 2278 2278 Frontiers Media SA 1 1792 1792
